comments:
Hi,

            I?m currently running Version: 4.0.1

Build id: 2005.06.22 of window builder pro, on Eclipse Platform

Version: 3.1.0

Build id: I20050513-1415.  (Sorry cutting and pasting here).

 

Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]

 

java version "1.5.0_02"

Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_02-b09)

Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_02-b09, mixed mode, sharing)

 

 

I have a Swing project where there is some encryption/decryption being done.  
In JDK 1.4x it works just fine, however when running in debug, using 1.5.0_2, 
the NoSuchAlgorithm Exception arises while running this code.

 

    try

    {

        keyCipher = Cipher.getInstance("DES/ECB/NoPadding");

        dataCipher = Cipher.getInstance("DES/ECB/NoPadding");

    }

    catch (NoSuchAlgorithmException ex)

    {

      ex.printStackTrace();

        throw new Exception("Invalid Object Reference 2");

    }

    catch (NoSuchPaddingException ex)

    {

        throw new Exception("Invalid Object Reference 3");

    }

    catch(Exception ex)

    {

        ex.printStackTrace();

        throw new Exception("Invalid Object Reference 3.5");

        

    }

 

 

java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException: Cannot find any provider supporting 
DES/ECB/NoPadding

      at javax.crypto.Cipher.getInstance(DashoA12275)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.IlmnEncodedFile.decrypt(IlmnEncodedFile.java:248)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.load(DMAP.java:176)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.<init>(DMAP.java:114)

      at com.ilmn.labmgr.PnlProduct$3.run(PnlProduct.java:263)

java.lang.Exception: Invalid Object Reference 2

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.IlmnEncodedFile.decrypt(IlmnEncodedFile.java:254)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.load(DMAP.java:176)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.<init>(DMAP.java:114)

      at com.ilmn.labmgr.PnlProduct$3.run(PnlProduct.java:263)

java.lang.Exception: Invalid Object Reference 2

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.IlmnEncodedFile.decrypt(IlmnEncodedFile.java:254)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.load(DMAP.java:176)

      at com.ilmn.file.enc.DMAP.<init>(DMAP.java:114)

      at com.ilmn.labmgr.PnlProduct$3.run(PnlProduct.java:263)

 

 

 

My initial thought was the jre was not able to find a provider for that 
particular cipher type.  I worked with security and settings for a while until 
I attempted to manually set up my bootsrap entry for debug.  When I did this, 
by only assigning rt.jar, jsse.jar and jce.jar, everything worked fine.

Sample works ok for me on 1.4.2 and 1.5.0. Can you add more details? have you 
modified the bootpath? can you attach a sample project that demonstrates the 
problem?
Marking as works for me without further steps/example to reproduce.

traces.message: Cannot find any provider supporting  DES/ECB/NoPadding
